snippet: An American base in Kunduz has become a refuge for hundreds of Afghan soldiers and civilians besieged by the Taliban forces that now control the city.
abstract: Reporter's Notebook ponders American military efforts to rescue Kunduz, Afghanistan, from Taliban, saying  it is hard not to think of city as anything but monument to futility; capital city, which was slowly recovering from earlier Taliban war, was home to First Battalion, 87th Infantry who arrived to protect it in 2010 and withdrew years later when province was declared mostly free of insurgents; Taliban forces have once again taken over strategic area and former American base now serves as refuge for Afghan soldiers and fleeing residents.
lead_paragraph: An American base in Kunduz has become a refuge for hundreds of Afghan soldiers and civilians besieged by the Taliban forces that now control the city.

headline.print_headline: As a City Falls, Wondering What U.S. Sacrifice Was For
